Detailed Description

Main source file for the Benito project. This file contains the main tasks of the project and is responsible for the initial application hardware configuration.

ISR ( USART1_RX_vect  ,
ISR_BLOCK   
)

ISR to manage the reception of data from the serial port, placing received bytes into a circular buffer for later transmission to the host.

Main program entry point. This routine contains the overall program flow, including initial setup of all components and the main program loop.

uint8_t PingPongLEDPulse

Milliseconds remaining for enumeration Tx/Rx ping-pong LED pulse

struct { ... } PulseMSRemaining

Pulse generation counters to keep track of the number of milliseconds remaining for each pulse type

uint8_t ResetPulse

Milliseconds remaining for target /RESET pulse

uint8_t RxLEDPulse

Milliseconds remaining for data Rx LED pulse

RingBuff_t Tx_Buffer

Circular buffer to hold data from the serial port before it is sent to the host.

uint8_t TxLEDPulse

Milliseconds remaining for data Tx LED pulse

USB_ClassInfo_CDC_Device_t VirtualSerial_CDC_Interface
Initial value:
    {
        .Config = 
            {
                .ControlInterfaceNumber         = 0,

                .DataINEndpointNumber           = CDC_TX_EPNUM,
                .DataINEndpointSize             = CDC_TXRX_EPSIZE,
                .DataINEndpointDoubleBank       = false,

                .DataOUTEndpointNumber          = CDC_RX_EPNUM,
                .DataOUTEndpointSize            = CDC_TXRX_EPSIZE,
                .DataOUTEndpointDoubleBank      = false,

                .NotificationEndpointNumber     = CDC_NOTIFICATION_EPNUM,
                .NotificationEndpointSize       = CDC_NOTIFICATION_EPSIZE,
                .NotificationEndpointDoubleBank = false,
            },
    }

LUFA CDC Class driver interface configuration and state information. This structure is passed to all CDC Class driver functions, so that multiple instances of the same class within a device can be differentiated from one another.
